data.title: Hide sidebar loses focus on terminal to editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7 Insider
- OS Version: macOS 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Focus on terminal
2. Realize I want more screen width, Cmd+B to hide sidebar
3. Now focus is on editor

I understand #14312 can be as-designed.
Toggling open sidebar -> focus on sidebar, then closing sidebar -> return focus to editor by default. This makes sense. But when terminal has focus, hiding sidebar -> focus on editor doesn't make sense.

data.title: Extension recommendations from Language Mode doesn't find Markdown extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.7.0 insiders
- OS Version:Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a Markdown file.
2. Language Mode > Search Marketplace Extensions for '.md'

Only an HTML grammar extension is show (viatsko.html-mason).
Expectation is that you would see a list of Markdown extensions.
Not sure if this is due to extensions needing to be updated to list their supported file extensions (.md), but I don't think this feature is very useful at present.

data.title: Lock TypeScript 2.0.6 dependency in NPM shrinkwarp if necessary
TypeScript settings header has period in the title
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.7.0 insiders
- OS Version:Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. File > Preferences > User Settings
2. Look at the collapsed Default Settings heading.

Only the TypeScript heading has a period at the end "TypeScript."
Not sure why (it is a heading not a sentence) and granted this issue is nit but we should be consistent.

data.title: Disable Extensions Option Unavailable
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T15:27:10.246Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0
- Extensions: Kasik96.format-indent-1.3.0, Telerik.nativescript-0.3.1, felixfbecker.php-debug-1.9.7, felixfbecker.php-intellisense-0.0.9

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a terminal instance
2. Enter `code --disable-extensions` and hit enter

Expected Result:
Application launches with all extensions disabled

Actual Result:
Error is displayed that the argument is not recognized

Note: I use iTerm2 and ZSH as my default environment. Could it be something with the pathing that was setup?

![1__dillieo_bombadil____projects_prayer-odyssey-mobile__zsh__and_login_component_ts_-_prayer-odyssey-mobile](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/991466/19732466/b0badb8a-9b55-11e6-9274-9cad7089983a.png)

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
When uninstalling an extension it is required to know following
- See all extensions depending on it
- Also uninstall extensions depending on it

data.title: Update hangs or is not installing
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.2.0
- OS Version:10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Selected Check for updates. Expected something to happen but no messages.
2. Went to select Check for update again and it says Installing update...

But it has not shown any change in a a while. There is no feedback if an update is downloading or if the install process has hung.

data.title: Uninstalling extension on Windows 10 does not prompt for a restart
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Uninstall extension through VSCode interface
2. Extension remains visible in the list
3. VSCode does not prompt for a restart

Note: On a Mac OS X and Linux works as expected.

Is behavior on windows a feature or a bug?

Thank you

data.title: Superfluous horizontal scrollbar is shown for hover dialog boxes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
from @kpreisser

monaco-editor npm version: 0.7.0
Browser: IE11/Edge 14
OS: Windows 10 Version 1607

Hi,

I noticed that after updating the Monaco Editor to Version 0.7.0, IE11 and Edge sometimes show a horizontal scroll bar when hovering over variables in TypeScript Mode.
1. Open https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/index.html with IE11 or Edge 14
2. In the Monaco Editor, scroll down to line 111
3. Hover on `canvas`
4. Notice that the dialog box has a horizontal scrollbar with which you can scroll 1 pixel:
   ![monaco-editor-scrollbar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13289184/19677878/a8694bc0-9a9b-11e6-818b-c72f0fcab613.png)

This does not occur on Chrome or Firefox.

Thanks!

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body: I'd like to see vscode support css-modules<sup>[[1]](https://github.com/css-modules/css-modules)</sup><sup>[[2]](https://github.com/webpack/css-loader#local-scope)</sup>, and the syntax of its [plugins](https://github.com/css-modules/postcss-modules-values). I know right now improvement on the css linter is [on the backlog](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13003#issuecomment-252610633), but just putting this issue out there for thoughts and documentation.

data.title: Allow saving markdown preview as an HTML document

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Feature request.

VS Code already does a great job of rendering markdown previews in a web view, it would be great if we could have the option to right click and save the preview as an HTML file like Atom allows us to do.

data.title: variable.parameter can not be themed for TypeScript only
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  1.6.1
  9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e
- OS Version:
  Linux nohomey 4.4.0-45-generic #66-Ubuntu SMP Wed Oct 19 14:12:37 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

Case 1. Add the following to any theme:

``` xml
       <dict>
            <key>name</key>
            <string>Function Argument</string>
            <key>scope</key>
            <string>variable.parameter.tsx variable.parameter.ts variable.parameter.typescript variable.parameter.typescript-react</string>
            <key>settings</key>
            <dict>
                <key>foreground</key>
                <string>#ED6A43</string>
            </dict>
        </dict>
```

Case 2.  Than change it to:

``` xml
       <dict>
            <key>name</key>
            <string>Function Argument</string>
            <key>scope</key>
            <string>variable.parameter</string>
            <key>settings</key>
            <dict>
                <key>foreground</key>
                <string>#ED6A43</string>
            </dict>
        </dict>
```

Function parameters currently can not be specificly themed for TypeScript (ts) / TypeScript React (tsx) only for the whole theme ....

In case 1. parameters will not be orange (not themed) and in case 2. they will be ....

Some screenshots:

Case 1. ts:
![ts](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8791438/19728802/6c6f7204-9b9d-11e6-910b-7a9fce04d7ca.png)

Case 1. tsx:
![tsx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8791438/19728808/71645090-9b9d-11e6-8e27-48afc039cab0.png)

Case 2. tsx:
![orange](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8791438/19728821/7bbe85f6-9b9d-11e6-92b7-8c2e14ace837.png)

data.title: pre-commit npm package breaks GIT commit
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Linux (Arch - latest)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. install pre-commit via npm `npm install pre-commit` 
2. configure pre-commit script to be triggered in `package.json`, e.g. 
   `json
   {
     "scripts": { "test": "uname -a" },
     "pre-commit": [ "test" ]
   }
   `
3. try to commit via the internal GIT tool

**Expected Results:**

committing should work without problems

**Actual Results:**

Committing will result in the following error:

``` shell
git commit --quiet --allow-empty-message --file -
.git/hooks/pre-commit: line 49: : command not found
.git/hooks/pre-commit: line 49: : command not found
```

data.title: Allow to undock the sidebar into a new window
data.body:
At work I can only use a small screen, and I need the explorer view always open.
The matter is that keeping it opened leaves very small place for actual code.
So I started looking for a undocking option, but I found out that there's none.
I'd really love to be able to switch between explorer and code in two different windows (just like I do, for example, with Chrome and Chrome Debugger).

(I don't know how to add tags to the request, I wanted to use explorer-files, feature-request, ux)

Thanks!

3. need to restart for update

it would cool, if changes are loaded without restart

data.title: VS Code debugger should be able to use an external file for environment setup
data.body:
**Issue:**
I am looking for ways to load a `.env` file into debugger environment.

`launch.json` provides an `env` section, where you can define such variables. In typical use cases, `launch.json` is being version controlled though, forbidding adding sensitive data, such as api keys.

**Expectation:**
It would be really helpful, if there was a syntax like the following example:

``` json
"env" : "${workspaceRoot}.env"
```

Not sure where to mention that, this is a **FEATURE REQUEST**.

data.title: Zooming Out Keyboard Databinding Issue
data.body:
